CONTACT_INFO: Matthew Dugan, Development Services Division Manager, 512-974-7665
MEASURE_NAME: Number of adopted small area plan recommendations
MEASURE_DESCRIPTION: This measure will allow us to track the number of small area plan recommendations we are monitoring and coordinating. Primary role of Neighborhood Involvement and Implementation Division is to coordinate implementation of small area plans, including neighborhood plans. This measure will allow us to track the number of small area plan recommendations we are monitoring and coordinating.

PROGRAM_OBJECTIVE: The purpose of Municipal Court Operations program is to process citations for the public in order to facilitate the swift administration of justice.
ACTIVITY_OBJECTIVE: The purpose of Civil Parking Administration is to process parking citations and payments, conduct parking hearings, and order vehicle booting or impoundment so that parking ordinances are enforced and due process is ensured.
ACTIVITY_DESCRIPTION: This activity is core, meeting the requirements of Texas Transportation Code, Chapter 682. Further it has an effect on both immediate and long-term public safety by preventing parking at dangerous or inappropriate locations and times of day. Also, it has a beneficial effect on a significantly large group of downtown commercial entities by maintaining their access at certain times of day to conduct business. The Civil Parking staff notifies persons when parking tickets become delinquent, holds hearings in disputed cases, and initiates boot/tow cases when eligible. Generally, if a person fails to resolve three or more parking tickets, a boot/tow case is initiated, and the person's vehicle is subject to booting and/or towing.
CORE_SERVICES: Conduct  parking hearings; Initiate parking cases, process sold vehicle affidavits, and maintain parking records; Issue boot and tow orders; Coordinate with law enforcement and other departments to coordinate the actual booting and towing of vehicles; Process payments of fines for parking; Research out of state registered owners.
MEASURE_NAME: Percent of cases terminated to filed - Parking
MEASURE_DESCRIPTION: Cases closed as a percentage of cases filed; indicates how well Court is keeping up with its case load

PROGRAM_OBJECTIVE: The purpose of the Elections program is to provide election services to voters, petitioners, City departments, media and candidates so they can participate in the election process.
ACTIVITY_OBJECTIVE: The purpose of the Elections activity is to provide election services to voters, petitioners, City departments, media and candidates so they can participate in the municipal elections.
ACTIVITY_DESCRIPTION: This is a core activity.  The legal requirements come from the State of Texas.  The election services include preparing the election calendar and candidates packet, compiling, reviewing and processing candidate applications; gathering and organizing the necessary information required for calling the election; obtaining and verifying candidate forms; managing GIS data and maps for Council districts; managing website consisting of election information; and managing contracts with Hays, Travis and Williamson Counties to conduct the election.  Post-election services include reviewing invoice from the counties for election services, canvassing the election results, and records management of election results.
CORE_SERVICES: Meet all election deadlines as established by State law; Manage all paperwork from Council candidates and office holders; Manage media requests for information; Manage contracts with Hays, Travis, and Williamson counties to conduct municipal elections; Plan and initiate the inauguration.
MEASURE_NAME: Number of City-wide ballots cast during the General Municipal Election
MEASURE_DESCRIPTION: Number of voters

PROGRAM_OBJECTIVE: The purpose of the Parks, Planning, Development & Operations program is to provide Parks and Recreation development, design, construction, and facility improvements to increase the availability of recreation opportunities; to provide planning, construction and preservation services for the Austin community in order to have safe, properly maintained Parks and Recreation facilities and natural resources; and to provide resource preservation, horticultural practices and delivery of environmental education programs to the Austin Community in order to protect and foster stewardship of the natural world.
ACTIVITY_OBJECTIVE: The purpose of the Park Planning and Development activity is to make facility improvements, and to provide planning, analysis, advice, construction, coordination, and acquisition in a timely, community-based manner in order to increase the availability of recreational opportunities for residents and visitors.
ACTIVITY_DESCRIPTION: This activity is a core activity. No legal mandate. This area renovates existing parks and facilities, and develops new parks and facilities.  This area develops the Capital Improvement Plan for the Parks and Recreation Department, designs parks and playground systems, prepares and monitors park acquisition and development grants, reviews subdivision and MUD proposals for compliance with dedicated parkland requirements, and reviews boat dock permits. Their customers are park users, PARD staff, the Parks Board, and other City departments.
CORE_SERVICES: Manage the construction of park improvements; Design and approve park plans and improvements; Parkland acquisition.
MEASURE_NAME: Percent of the City of Austin that is classified as parkland deficient
MEASURE_DESCRIPTION: The percent of the City of Austin's total land areas that is classified by the Planning & Development Division as parkland deficient

PROGRAM_OBJECTIVE: Building and Trade Permits and Inspections are a vital part of the built environment.  Conducting building and trade inspections during the various stages of construction safeguards the public?s life, health, safety and welfare.  Keeping track of permits along with a contractor?s license and registration also provides safety to the public.
ACTIVITY_OBJECTIVE: The purpose of the Service Center activity is to issue licenses, registrations and permits for builders, trade contractors, developers, and property owners so they can begin their projects.
ACTIVITY_DESCRIPTION: This activity is a core activity. This activity is mandated by State Legislation and local ordinances. This activity includes permits and licensing. The One Stop Shop Program and has dual relationships with other City-wide departments.
CORE_SERVICES: License registrations; Permit issuance; Plan retention; Escrow transaction management; Census report; Cancellations; Withdrawals; Reactivations; ABC Registration and validations provide assistance with Austin Build Connect.
MEASURE_NAME: Median Wait Time in Minutes for non-Cashier Customers in the Service Center
MEASURE_DESCRIPTION: Taking data from QLESS, this compares the start and completion times for each Service Wait ID, and gives a monthly median output of how many minutes customers have to wait for service in the Service Center. This excludes the 'Cashier' queue, and captures all other Service Center queue activities.

PROGRAM_NAME: Facilities Management, Operations and Airport Security
PROGRAM_OBJECTIVE: The purpose of the Facilities Management, Operations and Airport Security program is to maintain and operate a clean, safe and secure airport environment for the traveling public, business partners and other patrons of the airport.
ACTIVITY_OBJECTIVE: The purpose of the Asset Management Services activity is to provide planning and scheduling, resource management, and other support services to airport facilities, maintenance, operations, security and other activities, so they can maximize the availability of airport equipment, systems, and services for airport tenants and customers.
ACTIVITY_DESCRIPTION: Asset Management Services is classified as a core activity. No legal mandates. Asset management services is responsible for the airport's computerized asset management system (Maximo) and the central warehouse
CORE_SERVICES: Providing maintenance activity planning and scheduling, project coordination, resource planning, purchasing, materials management, and other support activities to other airport business units; Maintaining the data integrity of the airport's computerized enterprise asset management system; Managing the Department's central warehouse.
CONTACT_INFO: Valerie Slaughter, Asset Management/Business Operations Manager, 512-530-6327
MEASURE_NAME: Preventative Maintenance Costs Compared to Total Maintenance Costs
MEASURE_DESCRIPTION: Preventative maintenance costs compared to total maintenance costs

PROGRAM_OBJECTIVE: The purpose of the MBE/WBE Procurement Ordinance program is to provide information to the City of Austin necessary to provide development opportunities to small, minority and women-owned businesses participating in City contracting.
ACTIVITY_OBJECTIVE: The purpose of the MBE/WBE Certification activity is to review and audit applicants for the City of Austin in order to ensure that listed firms meet eligibility requirements of the Minority-Owned, Women-Owned, and Disadvantaged Business Enterprise programs.
ACTIVITY_DESCRIPTION: The MBE/WBE Certification Activity is a core activity.  This activity ensures that all businesses participating in City MBE/WBE procurement opportunities meet the eligibility requirements of the Minority- and Women-owned Business Enterprise Procurement Ordinance and its operating rules. Thorough review of business records, ownership documents and a site audit of facility and equipment, ensures applicant business meet the eligibility requirements for certification as an MBE/WBE and annual recertification is necessary.
CORE_SERVICES: Certification application review; Annual renewal review; Customer assistance; Site audits; Certification determinations; Commodity code review of certified firms.
MEASURE_NAME: Number of applications withdrawn
MEASURE_DESCRIPTION: Number of applications withdrawn by applicant.

PROGRAM_OBJECTIVE: To build, operate and maintain the transmission and distribution systems in the Austin Energy service territory in order to provide clean, reliable and affordable electric service to our customers.
ACTIVITY_OBJECTIVE: The purpose of the Distribution Services activity is to provide construction, operations and maintenance of the Distribution System in Austin Energy's service territory.
CORE_SERVICES: Design, engineering, and construction of both overhead and underground lines, transformers, feeders, streetlights and other associated equipment; Tree trimming; System restoration.
CONTACT_INFO: Dan Smith, Vice President, Electric Service Delivery, 512 505-7009
MEASURE_NAME: Advance Metering Infrastructure-Network Modernization
MEASURE_DESCRIPTION: Austin Energy is migrating it's meter populaution to a true, two way AMI system that enables enhanced direct meter access, real time data acquisition and increases in valued data quantities

PROGRAM_OBJECTIVE: The purpose of the Current Planning program is to manage the zoning process and interpret the Land Development Code, to manage the annexation process, and to protect neighborhoods, buildings, and sites that reflect the elements of Austin?s cultural, social, economic, political and architectural history.
ACTIVITY_OBJECTIVE: The purpose of the Historic Preservation activity is to identify and preserve historically significant buildings, sites and districts that reflect elements of Austin?s cultural, social, economic, political and architectural history.
ACTIVITY_DESCRIPTION: Austin?s Historic Preservation Program was created in 1974 to manage Historic Landmark Commission initiated zoning cases, owner initiated historic cases, and historic building surveys, and evaluate applications for demolitions and relocations, applications for certificates of appropriateness, applications for historic district building permits, applications for signs in historic districts and to administer the City?s tax exemption program for historic landmarks.
CORE_SERVICES: Designation of Local Historic Districts and City Historic Landmarks; Review building, site, demolition and relocation permits for properties in the National Register Historic Districts; Review demolition and relocation permits for all buildings over 45 years old; Historic landmark applications; Certificates of appropriateness; Supervise historic survey work
CONTACT_INFO: Joi Harden, Development Services Division Manager, 512-974-1617
MEASURE_NAME: Percent of initial demolition permits reviewed on-time
MEASURE_DESCRIPTION: To track working group progress on reviews
